item.title: Education
item.description: This page lists assorted educational materials I developed over the years. They range from simple sheet cheats to in-depth tutorials on structural bioinformatics. Feedback on existing content and suggestions for other tutorials are welcome. Intermediate Python (Link) (Source) A 3-hour Python workshop that aims to familiarize participants with conventions and features of the language that are not necessarily covered in introductory courses, but that are nonetheless common in daily Python programming, by building a road trip planner.

item.title: About me
item.description: I am a computational biologist and scientific software developer interested in protein structure and dynamics. I studied Biochemistry at the University of Coimbra, in Portugal, and later learned about structural biology and bioinformatics in the labs of Alexandre Bonvin in Utrecht and Michael Levitt at Stanford. My work has resulted in several peer-reviewed publications and some useful software packages for structural bioinformatics. In particular, I am the author and lead developer of pdb-tools and of the fcc clustering packages, and I help maintain the Bio.
